Sure, here's an expanded version of the first 10 days of "Around the World in Eighty Days" as the first 10 episodes of a television show:

Episode 1: "The Wager"

We open with Phileas Fogg, a wealthy and eccentric Englishman, at his gentleman's club in London. His fellow club members are discussing the latest developments in transportation and travel, including the opening of the Suez Canal. Fogg wagers that he can circumnavigate the globe in 80 days, and the other members of the club take him up on it. The wager is set, and Fogg departs London by train with his French valet, Passepartout.

B-plot: Fogg's estranged brother, who disapproves of his globetrotting lifestyle, hires a private investigator to keep tabs on Fogg's travels.

C-plot: Passepartout's ongoing struggle to understand and speak English, leading to comical misunderstandings and mishaps.

Episode 2: "Parisian Adventures"

Fogg and Passepartout arrive in Paris, France, where they board a train to Turin, Italy. Along the way, they encounter a pickpocket who steals Fogg's pocket watch. Passepartout chases after the thief and retrieves the watch, but the thief's accomplices give chase, leading to a thrilling rooftop chase scene.

B-plot: The private investigator continues to tail Fogg and Passepartout, reporting back to Fogg's brother on their movements.

C-plot: Fogg's developing relationship with a Frenchwoman he meets on the train.

Episode 3: "The Alps"

Fogg and Passepartout cross the Alps and arrive in Brindisi, Italy, where they board a steamer to Suez. On the train, they meet a group of wealthy American tourists, including a young woman named Abigail, who takes a liking to Passepartout. The two share a romantic evening on the deck of the ship.

B-plot: Fogg's brother attempts to sabotage his journey by planting false information with the private investigator.

C-plot: A storm brews on the horizon, and the passengers and crew prepare for the worst.

Episode 4: "The Storm"

Fogg and his companions encounter a storm at sea, which threatens to derail their journey. The passengers and crew work together to batten down the hatches and weather the storm. Meanwhile, Fogg and Abigail grow closer, much to Passepartout's chagrin.

B-plot: Fogg's brother's scheme begins to unravel as the private investigator discovers the truth.

C-plot: Passepartout's fear of water is put to the test as the storm rages on.

Episode 5: "The Stopover"

The steamer stops at Aden for a few hours before continuing on to Bombay. Fogg and Passepartout explore the city, encountering a group of Indian musicians and joining in a raucous dance party. Fogg also meets an Indian princess named Aouda, with whom he shares a deep conversation about life and love.

B-plot: The private investigator confronts Fogg in Aden, revealing his true identity and purpose.

C-plot: Passepartout's attempts to impress Abigail with his dance moves lead to embarrassment and hilarity.

Fogg and his companions continue on their journey by steamer to Bombay, India. Along the way, they witness a horrific ritual in which a woman is burned alive on her husband's funeral pyre. Passepartout, horrified by the spectacle, rescues the woman and takes her on board the ship. Meanwhile
